description:
During heat stack creation, we had encountered an unexpected API error from nova:

Resource Create Failed: Resources.Kolla Nodes: Clientexception: Resources[0].Resources.Kolla Node: Unexpected Api Error. Please Report This At Http: //Bugs.Launchpad.Net/Nova/ And Attach The Nova Api Log If Possible. <Class 'cd /ro'> (Http 500) (Request-Id: Req-24a122c9-0ac1-4921-9e52-0878a58f32b7)

This happens every time we attempt to launch the heat stack for kolla.

You should be able to replicate this by following kolla's cluster creation with heat guide here:

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/kolla/devenv-heat.html#create-the-stack

Issue occurred shortly after running:

heat stack-create -f kollacluster.yaml -e local.yaml kolla-cluster

Note: kollacluster.yaml remains un-edited, however local.yaml contains basic information such as our external network ID's etc.

We are using Liberty. Here is the current nova/heat RPM's installed:

[root@controller01]$ rpm -qa|egrep '(nova|heat)'
openstack-heat-common-5.0.0-1.el7.noarch
openstack-nova-cells-12.0.0-1.el7.noarch
openstack-heat-api-5.0.0-1.el7.noarch
openstack-nova-common-12.0.0-1.el7.noarch
openstack-nova-scheduler-12.0.0-1.el7.noarch
python-novaclient-2.30.1-1.el7.noarch
openstack-nova-objectstore-12.0.0-1.el7.noarch
openstack-heat-api-cfn-5.0.0-1.el7.noarch
openstack-nova-cert-12.0.0-1.el7.noarch
openstack-nova-conductor-12.0.0-1.el7.noarch
openstack-nova-api-12.0.0-1.el7.noarch
openstack-heat-engine-5.0.0-1.el7.noarch
python-nova-12.0.0-1.el7.noarch
openstack-nova-novncproxy-12.0.0-1.el7.noarch
openstack-nova-network-12.0.0-1.el7.noarch
openstack-heat-api-cloudwatch-5.0.0-1.el7.noarch
python-heatclient-0.8.0-1.el7.noarch
openstack-nova-console-12.0.0-1.el7.noarch

From nova-api.log:

2015-11-13 00:57:03.307 25129 DEBUG oslo_concurrency.lockutils [req-24a122c9-0ac1-4921-9e52-0878a58f32b7 0b5f4f6455c440de87641b99bcf1fccc 1621e5f8695d4af88cb5e4230d4dc244 - - -] Acquired semaphore "neutron_admin_auth_token_lock" lock /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/oslo_concurrency/lockutils.py:198
2015-11-13 00:57:03.308 25129 DEBUG keystoneclient.auth.identity.v3.base [req-24a122c9-0ac1-4921-9e52-0878a58f32b7 0b5f4f6455c440de87641b99bcf1fccc 1621e5f8695d4af88cb5e4230d4dc244 - - -] Making authentication request to https://control-internal.flashcloud.com.au:35357/v3/auth/tokens get_auth_ref /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/keystoneclient/auth/identity/v3/base.py:188
2015-11-13 00:57:03.309 25129 DEBUG oslo_concurrency.lockutils [req-24a122c9-0ac1-4921-9e52-0878a58f32b7 0b5f4f6455c440de87641b99bcf1fccc 1621e5f8695d4af88cb5e4230d4dc244 - - -] Releasing semaphore "neutron_admin_auth_token_lock" lock /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/oslo_concurrency/lockutils.py:211
2015-11-13 00:57:03.310 25129 ERROR nova.api.openstack.extensions [req-24a122c9-0ac1-4921-9e52-0878a58f32b7 0b5f4f6455c440de87641b99bcf1fccc 1621e5f8695d4af88cb5e4230d4dc244 - - -] Unexpected exception in API method

Please report this at http://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/ and attach the Nova API log if possible.

title: Class Openssl.Ssl.Syscallerror

comments.content:
During heat stack creation, we had encountered an unexpected API error from nova:

Resource Create Failed: Resources.Kolla Nodes: Clientexception: Resources[0].Resources.Kolla Node: Unexpected Api Error. Please Report This At Http: //Bugs.Launchpad.Net/Nova/ And Attach The Nova Api Log If Possible. <Class 'cd /ro'> (Http 500) (Request-Id: Req-24a122c9-0ac1-4921-9e52-0878a58f32b7)

This happens every time we attempt to launch the heat stack for kolla.

You should be able to replicate this by following kolla's cluster creation with heat guide here:

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/kolla/devenv-heat.html#create-the-stack

Issue occurred shortly after running:

heat stack-create -f kollacluster.yaml -e local.yaml kolla-cluster

Note: kollacluster.yaml remains un-edited, however local.yaml contains basic information such as our external network ID's etc.

We are using Liberty. Here is the current nova/heat RPM's installed:

comments.content: As a note, we are using SSL where possible.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~matthew-taylor-f

comments.content:
I set "insecure = true" where appropriate in heat.conf, which appeared to resolve the issue.

Saying that, we are using valid SSL certificates and key/ca cert's are correctly referenced through out the configuration.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~matthew-taylor-f

comments.content:
I also ran into the same error attaching volumes to instances:

[root@controller01 ~(keystone_dp-internal)]$ nova list
+--------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------+--------+------------+-------------+--------------------------------------+
| ID                                   | Name                                    | Status | Task State | Power State | Networks                             |
+--------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------+--------+------------+-------------+--------------------------------------+
| aae86360-84ba-47bd-85f0-835e8ff2f0d3 | kolla-test.dev.os.digitalpacific.com.au | ACTIVE | -          | Running     | Private=172.25.112.67, 101.0.122.134 |
+--------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------+--------+------------+-------------+--------------------------------------+

[root@controller01 ~(keystone_dp-internal)]$ cinder list
+--------------------------------------+-----------+-------+------+-------------+----------+-------------+--------------------------------------+
|                  ID                  |   Status  |  Name | Size | Volume Type | Bootable | Multiattach |             Attached to              |
+--------------------------------------+-----------+-------+------+-------------+----------+-------------+--------------------------------------+
| 0e7675fe-6cc6-4958-bd77-c93713643969 |   in-use  |       |  40  |     ssd     |   true   |    False    | aae86360-84ba-47bd-85f0-835e8ff2f0d3 |
| 6466414e-2a5e-42ca-8c56-308f74e4115e | available | test2 |  10  |     ssd     |  false   |    False    |                                      |
| 6fe4ffa7-3e8f-4e07-ba13-e1a1c3ed3a26 | available | test3 |  10  |     ssd     |  false   |    False    |                                      |
| 84e9ab4c-1e67-43ab-8e7a-077b9034fe93 | available | test4 |  10  |     ssd     |  false   |    False    |                                      |
| f20e9934-284b-4314-8791-731ae9ba5d22 | available | test1 |  10  |     ssd     |  false   |    False    |                                      |
+--------------------------------------+-----------+-------+------+-------------+----------+-------------+--------------------------------------+

[root@controller01 ~(keystone_dp-internal)]$ nova volume-attach aae86360-84ba-47bd-85f0-835e8ff2f0d3 f20e9934-284b-4314-8791-731ae9ba5d22 /dev/vdb
ERROR (ClientException): Unexpected API Error. Please report this at http://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/ and attach the Nova API log if possible.
<class 'OpenSSL.SSL.SysCallError'> (HTTP 500) (Request-ID: req-cbc37a07-f46b-4b2c-951c-895366aaeaba)

comments.content:
@Matthew Taylor:

We need additional information to do a proper bug triage.
Would you please provide the following information:

* The nova-compute logs (because of comment #3)
* The keystone logs (just to be sure)
* How did you configure SSL? (AFAIR, we have multiple config
  options for that)

After you provided this information, please set this bug status back
to "New".
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mzoeller

comments.content: [Expired for OpenStack Compute (nova) because there has been no activity for 60 days.]
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~janitor
